Please update the following program based on this instruction: Did you follow my instructions to do the following things? If not you need to do: Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.


Current program:
from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8
theta = 0.2
omega = 0.0
dt = 0.01

# Cyber input variables
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Objects
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, pos=vec(0,0,0))
ball = sphere(radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow)

# Initial conditions
ball.pos = vec(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01, pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos)

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    alpha = -g*sin(theta)/Length_I
    omega += alpha*dt
    theta += omega*dt
    ball.pos = vec(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    ball.radius = Radius_I
    rod.length = Length_I
